result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott A Sibilski

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Scott A Sibilski not in court.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci appeared by video for Scott A Sibilski.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Hearing held via Zoom.  Status conference held.  Defendant's appearance is waived.  Defendant has a TAD evaulation scheduled and Atty. Krejci requests a DPA hearing date. Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Scott A Sibilski in court.  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing held via zoom. Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints John Krejci as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Attorney Krejci accepts appointment.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $100.00 on the 1st of every month, commencing 10/01/2022 until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Case is adjourned in Branch 01.This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Home Depot-Wauwatosa and JJM.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 8/5/22. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Scott A Sibilski in court.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 1.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/3/22 @ 2:30p
